description: Rent out my cozy Brooklyn apartment (w/ A/C!) in trendy Greenpoint. This one-bedroom is equipped with a full kitchen & a full bathroom. Ten-minute walk to 7 train & five-minute walk to G train. This is a great place to stay while visiting Brooklyn. Greenpoint is quaint and sunny. The apartment is situated right by the Pulaski Bridge. If you walk across it on the pedestrian walkway, you'll see a beautiful view of the NYC skyline, and you'll reach the 7 train in ten minutes. Once you're at the 7, which is technically in Long Island City, Queens, you can take it to Manhattan, and the first stop is Grand Central (~3 minutes away), the next is Bryant Park (~4 minutes away), and the last is Times Square (~5 minutes away). Once you're at either of these stations, you have access to almost every subway: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, A, C, E, B, D. We have a queen size bed for a couple in the main bedroom, a toddler bed in our son's little bedroom, a comfy couch big enough for a tall person to sleep on and an air mattress. If you have a pet you may bring your pet with you just as long as you tend to its bathroom needs :) In addition to the main bedroom, there is also a small room that our 3 year old son sleeps in. If you are travelling with a small child, you may use this bedroom during your stay. There are plenty of toys too, of course!  The kitchen is small but there is a large dining table in the living room. There is a microwave, a full stove/oven, a high-speed blender and other kitchen appliances that you can use. We have a TV in the bedroom (no cable, but you can plug in your laptop or ipad to watch movies)

description: Beautiful, bright and spacious room in a modern apartment just 6 minutes from Prospect Park, Brooklyn Museum, the subway station (4/5 express trains to Manhattan) and cool restaurants & cafes. The space is trendy, sunny and designed with care. Crown Heights will be the new Williamsburg. Some of the neighborhood's best cafes, restaurants and takeouts are within walking distance (Barboncino's, Mayfield, Chavela's, Silver Rice, Lincoln Park, Blue Marble, Glass Shop, Pete Zaaz, ...). Within 5 minutes you're at Brooklyn Museum, the Botanic Garden or Prospect Park (Brooklyn's best farmers market every Sunday). The Franklin Ave subway station is 5 minutes away and you can get to Manhattan on the 4 and 5 express trains (30 min to Union Square). You can also walk to Brooklyn Museum in 5 minutes for easy access to the 2 and 3 local trains. Or take the B48 Bus right around the corner to get to Williamsburg.

It's a small, but cozy studio in a new building - exactly what you need when you travel. I rent it when I'm traveling, so it's not empty and hotel-like.  You'll have access to a beautiful rooftop and you'll see Empire State Building from your window changing its colors every night. Around is the best Manhattan view and walking area, a lot of places to eat around. No night-clubbing though.  You can rent a Citi Bike too. In addition to the subway (7 train - 5 min walk), there is a Ferry that can take you to the Financial District. It's a walk-up -- but that means easy roof access for lo-fi hangouts with great views of Forsyth Park and the downtown skyline. Strictly no smoking, please! We're young professionals and entrepreneurs, veterans of the city, and happy to point you in the right direction for your most niche interests. Sitting between Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side, our apartment is perfectly situated between some of the city's hippest neighborhoods. Endless amenities and explorations in Chinatown restaurants, the LES gallery scene, Soho bistros, Forsyth St Park, and legendary Bowery spots. 2-10 minute walk to the B, D, F, J, M, Z, 4, 5, 6, N, R trains means easy subway access to virtually any part of the city.

Located at West 32nd Street between Fifth Avenue and the intersection of Broadway and Sixth Avenue, you’ll find a charming strip of small shops, Asian-themed eateries, and several great hole-in-the-wall food spots. If you haven’t explored this section of New York yet, here are seven things to do while visiting Koreatown. Shop around. If you like shopping and scouring for hidden treasures, K-Town is ideal. description: Come enjoy Brooklyn and stay at our beautiful 3 bedroom modern abode located in the heart of Bedford Stuyvesant Brooklyn.  Features include stainless steel appliances, hardwood floors and a beautiful modern bathroom. With quite frankly the largest collection of largely untouched Victorian architecture in the country, Bedford Stuyvesant is known for its tight knit community due to its active block associations, frequented community centers, and array of community and cultural resources.   Over the most recent cycle, we have seen a wave of young professionals and families that are looking for more space, a more neighborhood feel, but also a bit of the grit that Brooklyn is known for.   Here you will find great restaurants,, bustling cafes, and artists showcasing their work all over buildings in the area. Right across the street from the blue line (A or C) train that takes you right to the city in 25 minutes or you can hop the B25 bus that gets you right downtown in 10 minutes.

It is furnished with a full size bed or two single beds, work table/desk and chair, reclining chair, TV, cabinets, shelves, a window air conditioner, and a full length mirror. If you're patient and can walk you can always find a free spot on the street though.

description: This room is large with a closet and a comfy queen sized bed. There is a nice view of the street and plenty of natural light. You will be a 5 minute walk away from the 2 and 5 train and a 15 minute walk from Prospect Park! The apartment is in an old, pre-war building with beautiful wood floors and a nice home-y vibe (if not a little creaky and dusty). The rooms are huge (even outside of New York/Brooklyn standards) and provide a lot of privacy to all of us staying here. The walls are pretty thick, so sound doesn't travel too much. The neighborhood is generally pretty quiet. You are free to roam your bedroom and any common areas (kitchen, bathroom, etc). If we are home more than likely you will be allowed to visit us in our own rooms, we just ask that you don't enter our private bedrooms if we aren't home. There is also a laundry room in the basement, let us know if you want to use it and we will show you! This is a 4 bedroom apartment, so there are 3 other roommates, including myself.

If you like cats and don't mind feeding them and doing a little light litter duty, you have found the right airbnb!
